alert.note: Alert for Boone County Except Southwest; Marion (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion and southeastern Boone Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1106 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Olvey, or 10 miles east of Harrison, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Additionally, localized flash flooding is possible across the area where 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour in isolated spots. Be careful concerning nightime flooding as water cover roads are a challenge to see at night. However, the cell has just moved to the east of where the higher rainfall amounts mentioned above have fallen, but still remains a concern. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bergman... Pyatt... Valley Springs... Dugger... Olvey... Crawford... Bellefonte... Everton... Zinc... Eros... Bruno... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
